byline.original: By CATHERINE SAINT LOUIS and MATT APUZZO

abstract: Obama administration plans to remove research restriction that has authorized only University of Mississippi to grow marijuana for use in medical studies; by allowing greater number of universities to create their own supply of research-grade marijuana, Drug Enforcement Administration will increase supply of marijuana available to researchers, and marks further relaxing of nation's official stance on marijuana.
snippet: The new policy could spur broad scientific study of a drug being used to treat dozens of diseases despite little rigorous evidence of its effectiveness....
lead_paragraph: The new policy could spur broad scientific study of a drug being used to treat dozens of diseases despite little rigorous evidence of its effectiveness.

headline.main: Obama Administration Set to Remove Barrier to Marijuana Research
headline.print_headline: Obama Administration Will Lift a Barrier to Marijuana Research
